content:
# The error indicates that the smelting process for the iron ore timed out, meaning that the stone furnace did not produce an iron plate within the expected time frame.
# This could be due to several reasons, such as the furnace being out of fuel or an issue with the input resources.

# Let's check the status of the stone furnace to determine if it has enough fuel and if it is processing the iron ore correctly.
furnace_status = inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)
print(f"Furnace status: {furnace_status}")

# If the furnace is out of fuel, I will need to add more fuel (wood) to keep it operational.
if furnace_status.get('fuel', 0) == 0:
    # Insert some wood as fuel.
    insert_item(Prototype.Wood, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=3)  # Add 3 wood as fuel.

# After ensuring the furnace has fuel, I will try smelting the iron ore again.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=1)

# I will wait again for the smelting process to complete.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait.
    current_inventory = inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)
    if current_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 1:  # Wait until we have at least 1 iron plate.
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout for iron ore - please check resources.")

# Once the smelting is complete, I will extract the iron plate to craft the assembling machine.
extracted_iron_plate = extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, position=stone_furnace_entity.position, quantity=1)

# After extracting the iron plate, I will now craft the assembling machine.
craft_item(Prototype.AssemblingMachine1, quantity=1)

# Finally, I will check my inventory to confirm the items after crafting the assembling machine.
print(f"Inventory after crafting assembling machine: {inspect_inventory()}")
